Package OOP_Project.application.controller

Class memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • OOP_Project.application.controller.memory
  • public class memory
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Bedetta Alessandro

    CLASS which represents the real working center of the program. It has all the necessary methods which respond to the requests made by the user. It also acts as memory, indeed, each time a listReview request is made, all the reviews are stored in the 'reviews' ArrayList; later on they will be processed by the application.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      memory()

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static java.lang.Object getAllDailyRevs​(java.lang.String date)
      This method returns all the review made in a specific day The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
      static java.lang.Object getAllWeeklyRevs​(java.lang.String date)
      Once the user specified a date ,this method returns all the reviews made in the week containing that date The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
      static java.lang.Object getDailyRevs​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String file)
      Once the user specifies a date and a file name, the method returns the list of reviews made on the specified file on that day.

      This method organizes the parameters to send the getMetadata request for a single file.
      static java.lang.Object getMetadata​(java.lang.String file)
      This method handles the metadata request by checking the file name given by the user.
      static java.lang.Object getStats​(java.lang.String file)
      Once the user specified a file name(or 'all'), the Method shows statistics made on the file, regarding the time lapses between all the requests made on it.
      static java.lang.Object getWeeklyRevs​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String file)
      Once the user specified a date and a file name this method returns all the reviews made in the week containing that date on the given file The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
      static java.lang.Object listFolder()
      This method needs to help the other methods getting all the file names in the folder The connection and the request to the DropBpx API are handled by the 'requestHandler' class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • memory

        public memory()

    • Method Detail

      • listReview

        public static java.lang.Object listReview​(java.lang.String file)
        Method needed to send the listReviews request and store all the data in the 'reviews' ArrayList. The connection and the request to the DropBpx API are handled by the 'requestHandler' class. If the operation goes well, the 'reviews' ArrayList is filled up, otherwise an error is returned.
        Parameters:
        file - The file we are working with.
        Returns:
        A JSONArray containing all the reviews made on that file.

      • getStats

        public static java.lang.Object getStats​(java.lang.String file)
        Once the user specified a file name(or 'all'), the Method shows statistics made on the file, regarding the time lapses between all the requests made on it. At the beginning the 'listReview' method is called and so the 'reviews' ArrayList is updated. The method relies on 'dateFormatHandler' class to handle the date format. The method also relies on 'statResponce' class to combine all the statistics in a single JSONObject.
        Parameters:
        file - The specified file or all the files.
        Returns:
        A JSONObject containing all the statistics.
        See Also:
        OOP_Project.application.models.statResponce

      • getDailyRevs

        public static java.lang.Object getDailyRevs​(java.lang.String date,
                                            java.lang.String file)
        Once the user specifies a date and a file name, the method returns the list of reviews made on the specified file on that day. At the beginning the 'listReview' method is called and so the 'reviews' ArrayList is updated. The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
        Parameters:
        date - The specified date
        file - The specified file
        Returns:
        JSONArray containing all the reviews the haven't been filtered.
        See Also:
        dateFormatHandler

      • getAllDailyRevs

        public static java.lang.Object getAllDailyRevs​(java.lang.String date)
        This method returns all the review made in a specific day The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
        Parameters:
        date - The specified date
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with all the reviews made on that day on all the file in the directory
        See Also:
        dateFormatHandler

      • getWeeklyRevs

        public static java.lang.Object getWeeklyRevs​(java.lang.String date,
                                             java.lang.String file)
        Once the user specified a date and a file name this method returns all the reviews made in the week containing that date on the given file The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
        Parameters:
        date - The week is passed by passing a date, the system automatically finds the corresponding week
        file - The file we want to check
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the reviews
        See Also:
        dateFormatHandler

      • getAllWeeklyRevs

        public static java.lang.Object getAllWeeklyRevs​(java.lang.String date)
        Once the user specified a date ,this method returns all the reviews made in the week containing that date The method also checks the validity of the date using the 'dateFormatHandler' class
        Parameters:
        date - The week is passed by passing a date, the system automatically finds the corresponding week
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the reviews
        See Also:
        dateFormatHandler

      • getMetadata

        public static java.lang.Object getMetadata​(java.lang.String file)
        This method handles the metadata request by checking the file name given by the user. If its a regular file name the getFileMetadata is called and the response is returned. If the file name is 'all' then the getFileMetadata is called for every file in the directory.
        Parameters:
        file - The parameter which specifies if we want to work on a particular file or on all of them
        Returns:
        An Object representing the file metadata or a JSONArray containing all the metadata

      • getFileMetadata

        public static java.lang.Object getFileMetadata​(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method organizes the parameters to send the getMetadata request for a single file. The connection and the request to the DropBpx API are handled by the 'requestHandler' class.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file we want to get the data from
        Returns:
        An object containing the metadata

      • listFolder

        public static java.lang.Object listFolder()
        This method needs to help the other methods getting all the file names in the folder The connection and the request to the DropBpx API are handled by the 'requestHandler' class.
        Returns:
        An Array list containing all the names (String)
